New Records: David Willey reached 100 ODI wickets in his final international game for England
David Willey became the 14th England men’s player to reach 100 wickets in the ODI format
Key Match Events: Jonny Bairstow and Joe Root hit half-centuries in the 337/9
David Willey starred on his final day in an England shirt with 3/56
England bowlers finished the tournament on a high as Pakistan succumbed to a 93-run defeat
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan began proceedings knowing that they had the slimmest of chances of still reaching the semi-finals
England captain Jos Buttler decided to bat after winning the toss
Post-Match Reflections: England secured a guaranteed top-eight finish that cements the team’s qualification for the next Champions Trophy
David Willey is the Aramco #POTM in his final international game after an impressive showing with the ball
Miscellaneous Highlights: England ended their stuttering campaign on a relative high
The match was played on a turning wicket
England ended their ICC trophy drought, winning their first title since 2013 is not relevant as this match was not a title match
The match was played in Kolkata
Others: The match was England's final game of the tournament
Ben Stokes' future in the One Day International format is uncertain
